page.title: 12Shopping at Kylesku
page.content: Shopping has changed greatly in the last sixty years. In the 1920s goods were delivered to Kylesku by boat, from Orkney. Because these boats called infrequently, large orders had to be placed. As roads improved there was not the same need for the boat.Vans served the area on a regular basis. When more people became car owners, the number of vans decreased until now only three vans come round, a fruit van, a fish van and a draper's van. Nowadays most people travel the ninety miles to Inverness, to stock up with food at the supermarkets. Many tourists stop to wonder and buy from our "immobile", mobile shop which has been part of the community for the last twelve years, supplying fresh milk and bread. Luckily for us, it also supplies ice-cream and sweets.
